author: gstein
msg: Sprinkle some comments about secure coding over HACKING.
Patch by: Alex Holst <a@area51.dk>
* (Secure coding guidelines): new section.
* (Document everything): describe how to document security boundries as
source code comments.
* Insert a missing page break.

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Remove expat-lite from the repository since we now rely upon apr-util to
find a suitable expat.
(This is also known as "does 'svn rm' on directories correctly" commit.)

author: jerenkrantz
msg: * ac-helpers/neon.m4: If apr-util decided to use its bundled expat, tell
neon that when configuring it.  If apr-util doesn't seem to be using the
bundled expat, then assume that neon can find it on its own.
This commit may need tweaking as we see what builds and doesn't.  This
should resolve the common cases of using a SVN tarball to bootstrap or
a system where expat is installed but neon isn't.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/commit.c
(commit_add_file): Fix this to not assume that all uses of add-file
are just pure "adds" ... they could be parts of a "replace" operation.

author: blair
msg: When browsing the Subversion repository with your favorite browser,
print the Subversion version number after the "Powered by Subversion"
message.
* Subversion/svn/subversion/mod_dav_svn/repos.c
(dav_svn_deliver): Print "version " SVN_VERSION "." after the
already existing "Powered by Subversion" string.  Include
svn_version.h.
